message_1: A math student needs to find the value of arccos(0.5).
message_2:
To find the value of arccos(0.5), we need to determine the angle whose cosine is 0.5. 

Recall that the cosine of an angle in a right triangle is the ratio of the adjacent side to the hypotenuse. In this case, we are looking for an angle whose cosine is 0.5, or:

cos(angle) = 0.5

One such angle is 60 degrees or π/3 radians. This is because in an equilateral triangle, if we draw an altitude, it bisects the base and creates two 30-60-90 right triangles. In a 30-60-90 triangle, the ratio of the adjacent side (half the base) to the hypotenuse (one side of the equilateral triangle) is 0.5.

Therefore, arccos(0.5) = 60 degrees or π/3 radians.
